H0.text: Momentum is the quantity Jon can calculate when he knows the force applied by the hydraulic jack to lift his car 0.25 meter off the ground after encountering a flat tire.

H1.text: Power is the quantity Jon can calculate knowing the amount of force he used to lift his car 0.25 meters off the ground with a hydraulic jack to change a flat tire.

H2.text: Pressure is what Jon can calculate from the amount of force he uses to lift the car 0.25 meter off the ground with a hydraulic jack.

H3.text: Work is what Jon can calculate when he knows the amount of force used to lift his car 0.25 meter off the ground with a hydraulic jack while changing a flat tire.

A4.text: The work W done by a constant force of magnitude F on a point that moves a displacement s in a straight line in the direction of the force is the product W = F ⋅ s

A5.text: The work done on the object is W = FgΔy = mgΔy
